intro: Psychrogeton andryaloides var. andryaloides, commonly known as the Andean buttercup, is a herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, which help protect it from harsh environmental conditions. Psychrogeton andryaloides var. andryaloides is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological role in its native habitat.
